purpose.summary: This copybook defines the data structure for a Pending Authorization Response record. It specifies fields for card number, transaction ID, authorization ID code, response code, response reason, and approved amount. The structure supports payment authorization processing in mainframe COBOL programs.
purpose.business_context: Credit card transaction authorization responses, capturing details from pending authorization requests (e.g., from card issuers)

business_rules.description: PA-RL-CARD-NUM field stores the card number as a fixed 16-character alphanumeric string
business_rules.logic_summary: Format enforced by PIC X(16) clause

business_rules.description: PA-RL-TRANSACTION-ID field stores the transaction identifier as a fixed 15-character alphanumeric string
business_rules.logic_summary: Format enforced by PIC X(15) clause

business_rules.description: PA-RL-AUTH-ID-CODE field stores the authorization ID code as a fixed 6-character alphanumeric string
business_rules.logic_summary: Format enforced by PIC X(06) clause

business_rules.description: PA-RL-AUTH-RESP-CODE field stores the authorization response code as a fixed 2-character alphanumeric string
business_rules.logic_summary: Format enforced by PIC X(02) clause

business_rules.description: PA-RL-AUTH-RESP-REASON field stores the authorization response reason as a fixed 4-character alphanumeric string
business_rules.logic_summary: Format enforced by PIC X(04) clause

business_rules.description: PA-RL-APPROVED-AMT field stores the approved amount as a signed numeric value with 10 integer digits, decimal point, and 2 fractional digits
